name: wids-profile

datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

nkey.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in VDOMs scope.
scope=vdom

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: wifi

POST.summary:
Create object(s) in this table.
 Access Group: wifi

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: wifi

DELETE.summary:

 Access Group: wifi

help: Configure wireless intrusion detection system (WIDS) profiles.

options.name: foreign
options.help: Enable the scan and monitor foreign channels. Foreign channels are all other available channels than the current operating channel.
options.label: Foreign
options.description: Enable the scan and monitor foreign channels

options.name: both
options.help: Enable the scan and monitor both foreign and home channels. Select this option to monitor all WiFi channels.
options.label: Both
options.description: Enable the scan and monitor both foreign and home channels

ap-scan-channel-list-2G-5G.name: ap-scan-channel-list-2G-5G
ap-scan-channel-list-2G-5G.help: Selected ap scan channel list for 2.4G and 5G bands.

ap-scan-channel-list-6G.name: ap-scan-channel-list-6G
ap-scan-channel-list-6G.help: Selected ap scan channel list for 6G band.

ap-bgscan-period.name: ap-bgscan-period
ap-bgscan-period.help: Period between background scans (10 - 3600 sec, default = 600).

ap-bgscan-intv.name: ap-bgscan-intv
ap-bgscan-intv.help: Period between successive channel scans (1 - 600 sec, default = 3).

ap-bgscan-duration.name: ap-bgscan-duration
ap-bgscan-duration.help: Listen time on scanning a channel (10 - 1000 msec, default = 30).

ap-bgscan-idle.name: ap-bgscan-idle
ap-bgscan-idle.help: Wait time for channel inactivity before scanning this channel (0 - 1000 msec, default = 20).

ap-bgscan-report-intv.name: ap-bgscan-report-intv
ap-bgscan-report-intv.help: Period between background scan reports (15 - 600 sec, default = 30).

ap-bgscan-disable-schedules.name: ap-bgscan-disable-schedules
ap-bgscan-disable-schedules.help: Firewall schedules for turning off FortiAP radio background scan. Background scan will be disabled when at least one of the schedules is valid. Separate multiple schedule names with a space.

ap-fgscan-report-intv.name: ap-fgscan-report-intv
ap-fgscan-report-intv.help: Period between foreground scan reports (15 - 600 sec, default = 15).

ap-scan-passive.name: ap-scan-passive
ap-scan-passive.help: Enable/disable passive scanning. Enable means do not send probe request on any channels (default = disable).

options.name: disable
options.help: Passive scanning only on DFS channels.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Passive scanning only on DFS channels

ap-scan-threshold.name: ap-scan-threshold
ap-scan-threshold.help: Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the AP to report detected rogue AP (-95 to -20, default = -90).

ap-auto-suppress.name: ap-auto-suppress
ap-auto-suppress.help: Enable/disable on-wire rogue AP auto-suppression (default = disable).

null-ssid-probe-resp.name: null-ssid-probe-resp
null-ssid-probe-resp.help: Enable/disable null SSID probe response detection (default = disable).

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable null SSID probe resp detection.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable null SSID probe resp detection

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable null SSID probe resp detection.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable null SSID probe resp detection

long-duration-attack.name: long-duration-attack
long-duration-attack.help: Enable/disable long duration attack detection based on user configured threshold (default = disable).

long-duration-thresh.name: long-duration-thresh
long-duration-thresh.help: Threshold value for long duration attack detection (1000 - 32767 usec, default = 8200).

weak-wep-iv.name: weak-wep-iv
weak-wep-iv.help: Enable/disable weak WEP IV (Initialization Vector) detection (default = disable).

auth-frame-flood.name: auth-frame-flood
auth-frame-flood.help: Enable/disable authentication frame flooding detection (default = disable).

auth-flood-time.name: auth-flood-time
auth-flood-time.help: Number of seconds after which a station is considered not connected.

auth-flood-thresh.name: auth-flood-thresh
auth-flood-thresh.help: The threshold value for authentication frame flooding.

assoc-frame-flood.name: assoc-frame-flood
assoc-frame-flood.help: Enable/disable association frame flooding detection (default = disable).

assoc-flood-time.name: assoc-flood-time
assoc-flood-time.help: Number of seconds after which a station is considered not connected.

assoc-flood-thresh.name: assoc-flood-thresh
assoc-flood-thresh.help: The threshold value for association frame flooding.

reassoc-flood-thresh.name: reassoc-flood-thresh
reassoc-flood-thresh.help: The threshold value for reassociation flood.

probe-flood-thresh.name: probe-flood-thresh
probe-flood-thresh.help: The threshold value for probe flood.

bcn-flood-thresh.name: bcn-flood-thresh
bcn-flood-thresh.help: The threshold value for bcn flood.

rts-flood-thresh.name: rts-flood-thresh
rts-flood-thresh.help: The threshold value for rts flood.

cts-flood-thresh.name: cts-flood-thresh
cts-flood-thresh.help: The threshold value for cts flood.

client-flood-thresh.name: client-flood-thresh
client-flood-thresh.help: The threshold value for client flood.

block_ack-flood-thresh.name: block_ack-flood-thresh
block_ack-flood-thresh.help: The threshold value for block_ack flood.

pspoll-flood-thresh.name: pspoll-flood-thresh
pspoll-flood-thresh.help: The threshold value for pspoll flood.

spoofed-deauth.name: spoofed-deauth
spoofed-deauth.help: Enable/disable spoofed de-authentication attack detection (default = disable).

eapol-start-flood.name: eapol-start-flood
eapol-start-flood.help: Enable/disable EAPOL-Start flooding (to AP) detection (default = disable).

eapol-start-thresh.name: eapol-start-thresh
eapol-start-thresh.help: The threshold value for EAPOL-Start flooding in specified interval.

eapol-start-intv.name: eapol-start-intv
eapol-start-intv.help: The detection interval for EAPOL-Start flooding (1 - 3600 sec).

eapol-logoff-flood.name: eapol-logoff-flood
eapol-logoff-flood.help: Enable/disable EAPOL-Logoff flooding (to AP) detection (default = disable).

eapol-logoff-thresh.name: eapol-logoff-thresh
eapol-logoff-thresh.help: The threshold value for EAPOL-Logoff flooding in specified interval.

eapol-logoff-intv.name: eapol-logoff-intv
eapol-logoff-intv.help: The detection interval for EAPOL-Logoff flooding (1 - 3600 sec).

eapol-succ-flood.name: eapol-succ-flood
eapol-succ-flood.help: Enable/disable EAPOL-Success flooding (to AP) detection (default = disable).

eapol-succ-thresh.name: eapol-succ-thresh
eapol-succ-thresh.help: The threshold value for EAPOL-Success flooding in specified interval.

eapol-succ-intv.name: eapol-succ-intv
eapol-succ-intv.help: The detection interval for EAPOL-Success flooding (1 - 3600 sec).

eapol-fail-flood.name: eapol-fail-flood
eapol-fail-flood.help: Enable/disable EAPOL-Failure flooding (to AP) detection (default = disable).

eapol-fail-thresh.name: eapol-fail-thresh
eapol-fail-thresh.help: The threshold value for EAPOL-Failure flooding in specified interval.

eapol-fail-intv.name: eapol-fail-intv
eapol-fail-intv.help: The detection interval for EAPOL-Failure flooding (1 - 3600 sec).

eapol-pre-succ-flood.name: eapol-pre-succ-flood
eapol-pre-succ-flood.help: Enable/disable premature EAPOL-Success flooding (to STA) detection (default = disable).

eapol-pre-succ-thresh.name: eapol-pre-succ-thresh
eapol-pre-succ-thresh.help: The threshold value for premature EAPOL-Success flooding in specified interval.

eapol-pre-succ-intv.name: eapol-pre-succ-intv
eapol-pre-succ-intv.help: The detection interval for premature EAPOL-Success flooding (1 - 3600 sec).

eapol-pre-fail-flood.name: eapol-pre-fail-flood
eapol-pre-fail-flood.help: Enable/disable premature EAPOL-Failure flooding (to STA) detection (default = disable).

eapol-pre-fail-thresh.name: eapol-pre-fail-thresh
eapol-pre-fail-thresh.help: The threshold value for premature EAPOL-Failure flooding in specified interval.

eapol-pre-fail-intv.name: eapol-pre-fail-intv
eapol-pre-fail-intv.help: The detection interval for premature EAPOL-Failure flooding (1 - 3600 sec).

deauth-unknown-src-thresh.name: deauth-unknown-src-thresh
deauth-unknown-src-thresh.help: Threshold value per second to deauth unknown src for DoS attack (0: no limit).

chan-based-mitm.name: chan-based-mitm
chan-based-mitm.help: Enable/disable channel based mitm detection (default = disable).

adhoc-valid-ssid.name: adhoc-valid-ssid
adhoc-valid-ssid.help: Enable/disable adhoc using valid SSID detection (default = disable).

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable adhoc using valid SSID detection.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable adhoc using valid SSID detection

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable adhoc using valid SSID detection.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable adhoc using valid SSID detection

eapol-key-overflow.name: eapol-key-overflow
eapol-key-overflow.help: Enable/disable overflow EAPOL key detection (default = disable).

invalid-addr-combination.name: invalid-addr-combination
invalid-addr-combination.help: Enable/disable invalid address combination detection (default = disable).

beacon-wrong-channel.name: beacon-wrong-channel
beacon-wrong-channel.help: Enable/disable beacon wrong channel detection (default = disable).

malformed-ht-ie.name: malformed-ht-ie
malformed-ht-ie.help: Enable/disable malformed HT IE detection (default = disable).

malformed-auth.name: malformed-auth
malformed-auth.help: Enable/disable malformed auth frame detection (default = disable).

malformed-association.name: malformed-association
malformed-association.help: Enable/disable malformed association request detection (default = disable).

ht-40mhz-intolerance.name: ht-40mhz-intolerance
ht-40mhz-intolerance.help: Enable/disable HT 40 MHz intolerance detection (default = disable).

valid-ssid-misuse.name: valid-ssid-misuse
valid-ssid-misuse.help: Enable/disable valid SSID misuse detection (default = disable).

valid-client-misassociation.name: valid-client-misassociation
valid-client-misassociation.help: Enable/disable valid client misassociation detection (default = disable).

pwsave-dos-attack.name: pwsave-dos-attack
pwsave-dos-attack.help: Enable/disable power save DOS attack detection (default = disable).

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable power save DOS attack detection.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable power save DOS attack detection

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable power save DOS attack detection.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable power save DOS attack detection

fuzzed-probe-request.name: fuzzed-probe-request
fuzzed-probe-request.help: Enable/disable fuzzed probe request detection (default = disable).

fuzzed-probe-response.name: fuzzed-probe-response
fuzzed-probe-response.help: Enable/disable fuzzed probe response detection (default = disable).

wpa-ft-attack.name: wpa-ft-attack
wpa-ft-attack.help: Enable/disable WPA FT attack detection (default = disable).
